result.execSummary:
The defendant Stanley J Holte was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Methamphetamine Precursors [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.65.
  • Burglary-Arm Self w/ Dangerous Weapon [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Both Cts 1 & 3 are concurrent with one another, with same conditions also concurrent
.

miscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing

No Contact with Toby L., Pawn America or National Pawn Co

No Contact with users or dealers of illicit drugs or controlled substances

Def is not to be at any location where illicit drugs or controlled substances are kept, used or sold
.

Comply with all assessments imposed by the PO

Comply with mental health assessments

Def is accepted into the Drug Court Program - comply with all terms and conditions of Drug Court

Def will be placed on a Drug Court Hold until Drug Court knows what to do with him.  Def to attend Drug Court on 4-10-14 at 4:00 p.m.

Def to write a letter of apology to Toby L.

Pay restitution as follows:  $1320 to Toby L., $145 to Pawn America, & $110 to National Pawn Co.

Pay 10% restitution surcharge

Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

Credit for 64 days if probation is ever revoked

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

.

superMiscConds.notes:
Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing - Maintain sobriety
.

Take all prescribed medications as directed

Complete any assessements or evaluations deemed necessary by the PO to determine what needs the defendant has

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt
